House made bread w/ hot and honey butter- yummy
Pizza-pretty good (I'm from Chicago and hard to impress when it comes to pizza)

The wine menu is pretty decent. 

Overall, everything was tasty and well done! If I am in the area, I would be compelled to stop by again.

Love the outdoor patio and atmosphere.. 5 stars there. Perfect for date night. Wine pours were pretty small. Would be better at happy hour. Ordered the salmon corn cakes- small in size- too much of a fishy taste, but would order for small,healthy app. Looks like Sunday and Monday nights are the nights to come for awesome specials- and heard the pizzas are great.. Would likely rank higher!
Stopped in after the Sunnyslope art fair. The outdoor patio was beautiful. Had an cocktail and enjoyed the ambiance.  The service was spot on.

Timo Wine Bar is one of my new favorite hot spots! I love all of the gluten free options, quaint ambiance, love live music and most importantly the memorable experience Nathan provides on a consistent basis.

We went to Timo Wine Bar to try it out for my birthday dinner before a show last Saturday night. We arrived around 5pm and were seated on the patio immediately. The patio is super cute and has great ambiance. We felt very comfortable right away and it only got better from there. I was pleased to find out it was still happy hour until 6pm and ordered glass of wine. We started with the anti-pasta platter based on our server's recommendation. It was delicious! We asked for a bit more bread because we gobbled up the few pieces it came with very quickly. Our server brought more right away and we (mostly me) ate every yummy bit on the platter. We ordered the wood fired chicken and the loaded Italian pizza for entrees. Both were delicious also, but most of the pizza came home with us - too full. Overall our service was fantastic, the food was great, and we will be back!
Timo has a great environment. The outdoor seating is nice. The food is just average though. This is not somewhere I would go out of my way for but it's worth a try if you're in the area.

Timo's was selected as this month's foodie adventure for our work party of 9 was which excellent with the help of our awesome server, Kevin who even helped us celebrate a couple of birthdays. We enjoyed Kevin's many recommendations for both good and wine!

Making a decision for Top Picks was tough as everything was deliciously prepared. We enjoyed all 3 thin crust pizzas but picked the (def not ordinary) Mediterranean for originality and the Chicken Jalapeño for creativity. 

The Spicy Copa stood out as the best amongst the other selection of delicious bruschetta. 

For Tapas, the crab cakes. 

Best for sharing was the Artichoke & Spinach dip, another def not ordinary

And for Oven Pizzas, the short ribs. 

To be honest, it was tough making choices because there wasn't a bad dish on the menu; which we probably covered about 90%. We will definitely keep this one at the top of the list! Thank you Kevin and Timo for the great foodie adventure, experience and a wonderful evening!

Visited Timo with several friends on a Friday night. We were seated on the outside patio, which has fabulous ambiance. Our table was under big trees and had lovely heating lamps to keep us warm. I would highly recommend sitting outside if you go.

We ordered a round of drinks, some of their famous bread for an appetizer, and then got various entrees for dinner. Our drinks took quite a while to arrive, despite that we simply ordered two glasses of wine and a Moscow Mule. We chucked it up to the place being busy, and moved on. 

The bread was excellent, warm and served with two options for dipping, a sweet butter or pesto sauce. I enjoyed both. For my meal, I chose the Prosciutto Thin Crust pizza. It was good, but my other friends ordered the Italian Meats Pizza, which was much heartier and more flavorful. I had wished I had gotten that. My third friend ordered a Prosciutto sandwich, which she described as just being "okay". She said she had expected it to be served warm, and it was cold. 

We were about 1/2 way through our dinner when I ordered a second glass of wine. It did not arrive until we were all finished eating, and then, our waitress poured it into my friend's empty wine glass by mistake. When we told her it was supposed to be for me, she asked if I would mind just drinking out of my friend's glass instead, rather than offering  to get another pour. I wouldn't have minded too terribly, except that I had really wanted to enjoy the glass with the rest of my meal, and it was already too late. :-/

Bravo Timo! Well done. 

I loved Bomberos and Timo has moved in to the beautiful spot and went easy on the remodeling.. If it ain't broke don't fix it! The patio was left intact and is gorgeous. I would recommend this for groups or for a romantic dinner for two. When it is cold the fire pit is awesome and it is quaint and charming. 

The inside is cozy and well designed, I usually opt to sit at the bar so I can watch them prepare my food and slide it in to the wood fired oven.  I went for brunch last week and it was awesome (see pics).

I had the benedict with avocado, tomato, black truffle, prosciutto and hollandaise  and it was simply divine!  I could not leave without trying the grapefruit brulee, equally scrumptious.

I can't wait to go back for dinner. They have a bottle of wine and a flatbread for $20 on Mondays!

I had hoped to be able to enjoy this place, as it it so close to my home. Unfortunately I walked out before I was able to try anything. I was greeted at the menu stand on the patio and told I could sit anywhere unless it had a reserved sign on it. That was the last time any staff member acknowledged my presence. I chose a table close to the entrance and watched as 3 other couples sat and were taken care of while my party remained invisible. After the server finally made eye contact I thought "phew, he just realized we were sitting here and he'll be right over"... Not the case. After 12 minutes we finally decided to just go somewhere else and as we were leaving the server was standing by the entrance and still didn't say a word to us. Drat, I really wanted to find a new go to place.
Awesome though a little pricey (Cabernet for $16 a glass?). Wonderful patio with firepit and comfy seating around it. Great atmosphere. Can't wait to go again.

I want to say that I was not expecting to find such a good restaurant in Arizona.
I was here for a convention with the American Cancer Society. I was with friends and we decided that we needed to go out to a nice girl night dinner the first night that we arrived. I never though that I would find this gem.

I would've given it a five star but the service was not the best. 

Food: was amazing! Such a good menu. They had so much good food. I went with a bunch of girls and we had share all our food. It was my first time having escargot and it was surprising good. There is a brie soup with truffle oil and I highly recommend that you try this. The spinach dip was amazing and I love the toast they serve with it. Also, if you like scallops, you must try this places scallops because they were cooked perfectly. 
They have a cool brochette plate where you can pick three of there brochette and the brochette is huge. I highly recommend doing the brochettes because they are big and totally worth the price (about $13). It is also very filling. However, my friend was little disappointed with the salmon because it wasn't warm (i think or there was too much). 

The atmosphere: Its very romantic and they have an outside patio area with lights and it so pretty. Also, there chairs are like little couches or comfy chairs. I sat with my friend on this little leather couch. Its a very intimate setting. Def a good place to bring a date or have a girls night. 
 
Lastly, I will say I really enjoyed the sangrias because they were so tasty and fresh.

Expensive, average food, gluten free bread options are misleading. They just skip the bread with bruschetta & simply call it gluten free. Should have listened to my gut instinct. I don't understand the hype, maybe it's for the wine which was decent but nothing to write home about.

Quick stop after work for a drink and appetizers. Just missed happy hour. If you can get there before 6pm they have some great deals. 
Very nice atmosphere, cute and trendy. They had the white chocolate beer that my husband and I love. The service was quick and the food was yummy! We shared the spinach and artichoke app along with the spicy salami pizza. We will be back again!

I eat eggs but I'm not a fan of them.  Today I had the best eggs ever on the Brunch Flat Bread at Timo's.  Now I understand why people eat eggs.  The crust was remarkable.  The burrata cheese was a new taste surprise.  Fruit bowl was mostly cantaloupe but that was OK because the quality of the fruit was great.  Service was on point.  Loved the inside vibe.  Can't wait until it cools down to check out the outside vibe.  Only helpful hint...Mimosa was too tart.  Would have preferred more orange juice.  I was there with a brunch group and everyone else had great food too.

Quite the corner bistro.  Fresh ingredients always make for a good food, which Timo offers.  Had the flatbread pizzas from the wood fire oven.  Enjoyed the margherita and the home-made sausage varieties.  Dark and romantic atmosphere, good place to take a date as there is ambient music without being in-your-face about it.  Servers are very friendly and are eager to make suggestions for both food and wine.

We discovered that place by total accident because I would most likely never go to a restaurant in sunny slope unless it really was amazing. We drove past it on our way to our actual destination but the wait was too long so we drove back to timo.

As a starter, We got their wings and they were really good. They were really fancy shmancy, which I don't prefer. I like going caveman on my sloppy wings. Then for our meals we got the margherita pizza and Mediterranean thin crust pizza half with chicken on it. We always determine if a place is good by their cheese or margherita pizza. This place had a delicious margherita pizza! They had lots of fresh basil on it. The Mediterranean pizza was good. It was super crispy and flavorful. I don't like chicken so I didn't try the other half but my bf liked it. And it was a major plus because most of the food is wood fired! 

Service was good and ambiance was reaaallyy nice. We will definitely be back.

Ok, so a little bit of a mixed bag, but leaning much more towards the positive. Very convenient parking and a garden area out back. Very clean, nice decor, great ambience, tastefully decorated. Reminded me of similar places in London. However the bench seats are too low and soft, my companion almost vanished into one. I had a glass of Reisling, and to be honest if I didn't know it I would have said it was a Chardonnay. It lacked the crispness and 'bite' of a good Reisling, but not unpleasant to drink. My companion's mimosa was excellent! The food was really good too, and nicely presented and the service was great. Overall a very pleasing experience and I certainly intend to go back.

We had a great time the other night for Ladies Night Out With Wine! I'm sure most of the greatness was the company we shared, but the location totally helped. 

We got a great little comfortable table inside the newly remodeled building, side note: it used to be Bomberos. It looks so much more open and inviting than the old place was. They have the doors all open and great decor. 

We ordered a couple bottles of wine, had some tapas, flat breads, soup and salads. Their menu looks very inventive and interesting. I had a bite of the rib flat bread, and it was amazing, I would love to go back and try it again. The girl shared the brie soup, and I am pretty sure they loved every bite, since when the waiter tried to clear it from the table he almost got a fork in his hand. My Cesar salad was OK, the chicken with it was really good. 

It is close to my house, so I am very excited to put it Ont he wine bar rotation!

Let me start by saying I am sure a future review with a 5th star is pending - because this place is fantastic.  

The food is great.  I have had an appetizer, the Timo Trio for lunch, and I have had a flatbread pizza.  Nothing disappointed.  Their waitstaff is attentive, they give you more of whatever you need - and don't hassle you about it.  I love the new decor (yes, I said new decor - I frequented this place when it was... what it used to be.)  It has a very urban-classy vibe.  

Four stars because...

We went on a pretty slow lunch Friday a couple of weeks ago and it took us about 40 minutes to get our food.  My panini with my Timo Trio was not great (sorry, it wasn't) but the rocket greens and the soup MORE than made up for that.  I had the tomato soup and I am looking forward to trying the Brie.  However, given that we were on a workday lunch, we would have appreciated faster service.

The mojito lemonade!  It's fantastic!  So fantastic I would pay for two!  I get that it's probably not free refills because I am sure they are not the easiest or most fun thing to make, but i would be more than happy to pay for a second.  Please ask me next time.  Each time I have ordered it I have never been asked if I'd like a) a lemonade (plain) refill or b) another mojito lemonade.  It's your tab and your tip and all, but I think I'd go for it if it were me.  :)

Also, I am not sure that this is the case yet, but there does not appear to be a place for any live music.  Even a singer/songwriter guitar player would be awesome.  It doesn't have to be as elaborate as "it used to be" - but that was one of the incredible things about this place/location.  Just something to think about.

So, like I said, I am sure we will be back and back and back and a 5-star review is well in the works.  Can't wait to see how this place grows and changes and works out any quirks.

Now that I have the opportunity to write a review, I will be able to remove the bitchy quick tip.....
I used to live over by this restaurant.  I have only been here for dinner.  I must admit that the food is awesome.....now for the reason they lost stars.

I made plans to meet friends at the new farmer's market on Central and Northern.  They asked if there were any cool places to eat for breakfast and I immediately thought of this place.  I checked on-line to see if they still had brunch.  The hours posted on the site said they opened at 8.  So I planned the day's events around meeting at Timo's at 9 am for breakfast.  

I showed up early so that I could coordinate and they were closed.  There were no cars in the parking lot.  I immediately called the number and it was just a message saying "you have reached voice mailbox number blah blah blah, please leave a message."  I immediately looked for the closest restaurant for breakfast near me so I could divert my friends.  

I also added the quick tip stating: Don't bother going here for bfast - they are closed with no explanation on their voice mail.  As I was driving away to go to another breakfast joint, I saw a sign that said remodeling - in all fairness, it may have been the adjacent building.  Anyway, I ended up getting an email from someone saying that there is a sign somewhere (on a fence????) saying they open at 9:30.  I have since removed the quick tip.

Long story short....GOD DAMN IT!!!!!  Web content changes take a matter of SECONDS!!!!  If you change your hours then change your fucking web site.  I have no tolerance for shoddy business practices.  They lost 2 stars because of the horrible experience.  

CHANGE YOUR EFFING POSTED HOURS ON YOUR SITE!!!!!!

Really cool spot, patio is awesome and the dining room has two huge openings to the outside. Great happy hour deals to go along with great food and drinks. The short rib pizza ties together sweet potatoes, banana peppers and a nice amount of cheese for a great range of flavor. I'm also usually disappointed with antipasto plates but theirs is terrific. Will be back soon!

Stopped in here for lunch last week and was very pleased.  We had an order of  bruschetta and a proscuitto sandwich which was easily enough for 3 people. Service was excellent.  Menu has some similarities to Bombero's but there are clearly differences.  The wood oven adds a real punch to the food.

Went here for a Birthday Party, great atmosphere, and setting for dinner.

Date night specials on Sunday and Monday for dinner do are a steal that include a bottle of wine.

I absolutely love Timo Wine Bar! Second time here and second time by myself, although I do not live in the area (commute for work) I will definitely bring my husband and stop by with co-workers. I absolutely love the environment, kind of reminds me of a place you would duck into in the city (San Francisco), and sit back, relax and enjoy the atmosphere completely loosing track of time. Observing the interactions between the cooks, waitresses and what appeared to be the manager on my first visit it is obvious that they work in unison. Had the same bartender, Amy has been amazing, answered all of my questions and treated all guests equally whether they ordered one beer and left, or in my case 3 Sangrias and an appetizer, and is also willing to hold a conversation (big plus in my book)!

Now the food and drinks.....drumroll please.....I've tried two different dishes on their happy hour menu and was not disappointed!!!!! And the Sangria? It's  made in house and are generous with the portions. This is now my go to spot after work, either alone or with someone else! 

I could go on and on but why don't you come and experience yourself!

I have gone 3 times each time the person or persons that I went with ended up referring their friends and going again.  It is small .. or should I say intimate inside.  The patio is beautiful.  Love the Escargot Barcelona from the Tapas menu has the perfect accent of spinach and sundried tomatoes. The sausage kale soup, andouille sausage, garbanzo bean tastes fabulous and is filling enough for a meal for me/  Great drink specials and weekday Happy Hour food specials   Love it will go back again

Food was pretty good I had the short ribs and hubby had lamb.  Both were cooked like it was a pot roast.  Mine was a bit salty..  Wanted to pour a little water on the food.   We did have a bread appetizer with pesto and some sort of butter honey.   Butter honey  was delicious,  pesto was drowning in olive oil so didn't have much flavor.   The ambiance of the restaurant was cozy and relax.   Waitress was friendly but didn't seem to want to take the time to explain anything.   For the price of the two entrées and one appetizer $54 was a bit expensive.  This was not really worth it to me.   I've had better food in an upscale environment so we won't be coming back.   But im glad I did try it.
Omg best brunch I have had in a long time.  Great bloody Mary's, relaxing patio, and amazing food!
Yummy tapas. Delicious pizzas. Everything was fresh and unique. If my 12 year old liked it.
Great food and great atmosphere. Had the egg white frittata and the hibiscus iced tea. Enjoyed the cookies too!

This was a cute little wine bar that I'm very glad I found thanks to Yelp! It was a Thursday night and there was a decent amount of people outside in the patio area. I was glad that I had made a reservation in advance because it was awesome going right to our table for 10 girls without a wait of any hassle! the staff was extremely helpful (and we all agreed they were super cute). The weather was nice outside and although it got colder as the night crept in, they had a huge fire pit and gas powered heaters scattered throughout. The live music was wonderful and the musician was funny and took requests. He even allowed our friend Ricki to perform her original song! It was awesome! We ate a bunch of appetizers like salmon bruschetta, chicken wings, escargot, and spinach dip I think it was. The flatbreads were great too! They have a great selection of wine, we stayed for hours getting tipsy in a classy manner, it was after all my sister's last night as a single lady!
Love Timo's! Great food, great wine and a great atmosphere! I have been there several times and I always have a great meal and a wonderful time!

Wood-fired brick oven recipes with much of the preparation done in front of you. The restaurant is very romantic. Tho I sit at the bar, I see a beautiful xeriscape courtyard, urban oasis out back. Diners looking for a unique culinary experience will find it.

Salmon Tapas.  I'm a real fan of salmon. It's a flavorful fish. When my two tapas are served they look delicious. I also enjoyed a brew from their beer garden. A winter ale, and it paired perfectly with my meal. 

This house is a place where the wood-fired oven community can enjoy wonderful recipes. Brimming with creative, tasty dishes and wood-fired cooking know-how. I have come to the conclusion that my kitchen at home deserves a wood oven.

EAT HERE! This place exceeded my expectations. First, I never stepped foot inside Timo's but I feel that I didn't need to. The outside is absolutely beautiful. The ambiance was intimate and relaxing. Comfortable chairs covered the patio with settings big enough for large groups or small tables of two for a more intimate evening. The large fire pit in the middle was where my group decided to sit. Even on a chilly night, the blazing fire keeps you warm and cozy, not to mention the standalone heaters scattered around the patio. Beautiful Einstein lights hang about the trees overhead with soothing music making for the perfect dinner. 

Enough about the look, let's talk food. First, take my word for it and order the bruschetta board appetizer. You pick three different topping styles and, though I'm sure they're all delicious, you HAVE to try the goat cheese one. If I had to complain, I'd say there should be more goat cheese on it! Beautifully displayed, the three we ordered (roasted tomato, goat cheese, & cubano) all tasted sensational  and it's priced very appropriately for the amount and taste quality of the food. 

My group all ordered salads and had no complaints. We tried the Brussels sprout, salmon, and roasted butternut squash salads and licked he bowls clean! All healthy options that you can tailor pretty easily to your preference. I'd definitely recommend eating here and next time I'm in Phoenix, I'm coming back!

I came here on a hot Phoenix afternoon and sat outside. The outside was decent. Nice chill decor and large trees for shade. (except the tree kept on dropping things on the table). I tried the Bruschetta (the spicy copa..., apples..., and roasted eggplant...). The roasted eggplant didn't have a lot of flavor. The apples were hard to eat because they were just cut up long ways and stacked on the bread and kept on falling of when I bit into it. The fig jam was good though. The most flavorful was the spicy copa, but it was kind of gross seeing oil drip down when I saw my boyfriend eating it. The bread itself wasn't that good though, either. Also tried the TImo Benedict, and that was pretty tasty. The egg was nicely cooked, but I got grossed out after crunching on some egg shell (I was able to spit some of the egg shell out.) The asparagus was also really oily. Overall, the flavors were good and there was a good attempt at making its dishes better than average.

Bopped in here for the the 'Monday Night Special': flatbread and a bottle of wine for $19! Yay deal!

We enjoyed the pancetta and asparagus flatbread, with caramelized onions added. Scrumptious! We also ordered the tamarind drumettes with sweet chili sauce. The place was hopping and our seats at the bar provided a cozy perch to people watch and enjoy our munchies. 

You know when you first meet someone and it may be too early to tell, but you think it could really be something special? That's how I'm feeling about Timo. I hope it's love.

Used to adore this place, everything was first rate, food, menu selections, beautiful patio and interior. Was there recently, and served my favorite crab cake and egg dish with something that was supposed to be hollandaise. Tasted like someone opened a pouch and hastily mixed warm water with a Hollandaise mix, ( not even a decent mix). So sad.

This is a great little restaurant and wine bar, a very unexpected surprise when I went to dinner here after visiting grandma in the hospital down the street.  The food is good and the service is excellent.  It's not at all what I expected to find on Central and Dunlap.  Hopefully I won't be visiting JCL hospital anytime soon, but if I am in the area I'll probably stop by Timo to get something to eat.

No one wears gloves at all when preparing any food, they touch everything.  Will not
go there again, and, it is too small and too noisy

This place was awesome! I went on a weekend just to grab a glass of wine with a  friend. Well several glasses later, we were still there. The outside patio is a great spot, if you are lucky enough to get near the fire pit. But if not, there are heat lamps on the outside tables to keep the warmth. The staff was friendly and helpful. And attention gentlemen! Incase you are looking for a great date night, this would be the place to go. Hint hint! Although I can see this place getting very crowded, so I'd make reservations.

The bruschetta is a very good size. You get 3 choices and all are fabulous. We also tried the antipasto, it was a nice plate but I didn't care for the cured meat selection. Our waiter was courteous and informative. Great outdoor seating with umbrellas for daytime and candles for evening ambiance.

After seeing pictures online I SO wanted to love this place! However, it just missed the ball with me.

The overall feel and vibe is there, but the outside dining area definitely needs some TLC! It looks almost "abandoned". There were leaves everywhereee, spiderwebs on the fence that lines the dining area, random decor pieces, including CDs and bottles hanging from the trees, a rat bait station in plain view... I mean really, c'mon! I told my friend (who was dining with me) that it looks like it was once a great place that the owner gave up on. 

I get that you're going to face the elements when dining outside, but you still want it to "feel" clean. When you walk in, the far left corner of the patio (where the bait station is) is so empty and not very nice to look at. They could add some cacti or flowers or something to add appeal.

Their saving grace for me was the food. It was delish! We had the spinach and artichoke dip, ceviche (steep price!), and buffalo wings. It was all good!

I didn't get a chance to look at the interior dining room, but my friend said it was pretty. The bathrooms were nice & clean. Parking lot was teeny tiny! 

Overall we had an enjoyable experience, but it was lacking. I am tempted to go back at night to check out the ambiance and live music.

What a wonderful way to spend the evening! Sipping wine under the patio lights, dining on bruschetta and antipasto, it was the perfect end to a busy day. Michelle could not have been more attentive & helpful. We may have to return tomorrow night - there were so many menu options that we could easily have been there for hours drinking wine & nibbling on the small plates.

We go to Timo all the time and LOVE the food. Everything at Timo is fresh and delicious. If you are looking for a restaurant to have happy hour with friends, this place is a great pick. The decor is great and the outside patio is cozy. The peach sangria is to die for. My only complaint is the service can be hit or miss. Perhaps the  staff could use a little more training and it wouldn't hurt to hire more hosts to seat guests.

Date night - we sat out on their nice patio and enjoyed a lovely meal. We shared a generous portion of olives (appetizer), delicious escargot, and I had the butternut squash salad while my husband devoured the brussel sprout salad. Wine list is more than adequate - beer list lacks domestics. Servers were attentive and paid attention to the details. We shall return!

Arrived for brunch today at approximately 11:30am; no other customers.  Sat on the patio and ordered a delicious brunch however was overshadowed by a multitude of flies!  

We cut our brunch short because of the flies-what a health hazard!  And when is the last time someone gave this place a good scrubbing?  The bathrooms are dirty with neglected maintenance-what a disgrace!

Clean up your act or the health department will close you down

I went to Timo for the first time last week for Happy Hour.   I will definitely be back.  The service was excellent....Amy the bartender was extremely attentive and gave great suggestions.  The spinach pesto pizza with sun dried tomatoes and carmelized onions was off the charts.  It is an intimate lounge type setting, not too loud, great music and I cannot wait for the weather to cool off because the patio looks so comfortable and cozy with a few tables for 2 nestled in the trees....truly romantic.

it was okay.

We bought a groupon for this place and went on a sunday night. It was a small restaurant, nicely designed, and good ambiance. It took about 15 mins to get seated. Just nothing really stood out. We asked for suggestiosn from the menu and they told us to try the chicken and I really didnt think it was that great. Felt like chicken that could have easily been made at home rather than a fancy restaurant.

They did have a strong selection of wines and drinks. Maybe a better place for brunch or happy hour, but just for regular dinner nothing special.
Does not get enough credit. My first time eating here was the other day, the pizza was amazing!! The place was so very cute with great service! I hope it remains this way
Love the vibe here and the food is great! Staff is friendly and attentive. Nothing like it in the area, I will be back!
Great meal.  Antipasta player chicken Blt fabulous.  Meatballs delicious  but small but worth nine.  Empty night but atmosphere feat for date night. Server attentive

Love the food. Love the patio. Love the decor. Love that it is so close to our house. 
The bar is gorgeous. The food is great. They have a Brie soup that is to die for. My husband orders it every time we go there...The food is cooked in their pizza oven and is fabulous. 

Great wines too. I had an unusual white wine last night that was fabulous. 

I think I'd be totally happy with a glass (or 2) of wine, an order of their incredible bread straight out of the oven, and a bowl of brie soup!

I love everything about this place.  The food (particularlly the wings) is incredible, the drink list makes me happy (the balsalmic bloody mary is great), the brunch is excellent, the patio rocks, and best of all?  I'VE NEVER HAD BAD SERVICE HERE.

Hurray Timo.  Hurray.
One of my absolute favorite places, currently to hot to sit out on patio but inside is to cute. Stopped in for a quick wine, and the Pinot Grigio was perfect.  Must try restaurant.

Pizzas were pretty good.  Eggplant appetizer was very good.   The lemon oregano chicken had too much lemon and not enough oregano.  A tually could not taste any oregano, only sage.  The green beans were under cooked and tough.   Atmosphere is great.  Wine is great. Staff is great. Weather was great.  We really enjoyed the salmon. Yes, we ate too much.
I never give 5 stars but this deserves more than 4 and the chef cooks at the wood fire oven in the middle of the kitchen so you can watch your food get cooked!
Wondrous food & atmosphere! Amy is spot on as a bartender indeed :)  Keep the drinks coming too muahaha!

I guess there's a reason to become a regular at certain places: Timo's offers several. The food is expertly and tastefully prepared; the environment is truly relaxing, whether outside by the fire pits or inside at a table or the bar, and the service is friendly and not obnoxiously attentive. If you sit at the bar you may learn something new and interesting from lovely and engaging Amy, the bartender.
It's  a nice neighborhood place that welcomes new faces, and hopes they'll come back.

I think this might be the spot. this place is so cute. Love the layout. :))) butttttt... let me start off by saying parking was ridiculous!!! Who has a parking spot that only has 8 spots... Omg. I parked right across the plaza from the gas station. We walked!!!! :(

We started off with the artichoke dip. It was fabulous. It was spot on creamy and hot. The bread with crunchy and it well with the dip. We also had the margherita pizza. Very declious :))

The waiter wasn't very helpful nor seem like he likes his job. I asked for new plates because the plates we have on the table was wet and muggy look. He took forever, so I went and got it myself. This was his response when he saw me get them " thanks for getting them, (shaking his head) " wow.  really?!? Oh there's more. So my girlfriend and I ordered the Creme Brule. He came over and had the torch to caramelized the top of the creme Brule. I said awesome, do you mind if I record this. He said " wow, what is this world come to when you have to instagram everything" seriously?! I just snarled at him.  Seriously,  the food was great, the dessert was delicious.  But this guy must be a joke... riight?!

I'll be back, but not to that kind of service.

Another visit to Timo.  As always, quickly seated and attended to.  Had my usual butternut squash soup and corn bread (not like regular corn bread...this stuff is insane!) 
and this time had diver scallops...with pesto.  Surprisingly delicious.  I had intended to ignore the pesto and ended up swiping the scallops in it!  And then, when I left and realized, 20 minutes later,  that I had left my phone there, I went zipping back.  The waiter had it tucked safely behind the bar and when he saw me came running over with it.  Great service and, as always, a great dinner.

I had my 30th birthday there this past weekend and could not have been happier with how accommodating the staff was and how well the whole night turned out. I received many comments from the guests about how great the 2 servers were with keeping the drinks fresh and the kitchen for keeping the assortment of food well stocked all night. Highly recommend the charming patio for any holiday party, birthday party, engagement party, etc. Thank you for a wonderful evening!

Timo has a nice atmosphere out on the patio as well as inside the dining area. The food at this establishment may pleasantly surprise you.  I tried a Wood fired Lamb Kebab with cherry tomato and tzatziki sauce.  Next, I ordered Cedar Plank Ruby Red Trout with roasted cauliflower,  baby zucchini,  grilled lemon, caper butter. Also, I picked out a dessert Vanilla Tiramisu with lady fingers, berries and real whipped cream.
Took my wife for her birthday and it was amazing. I want to give thanks to Michelle she was on point.

I tried this place for the first time last Friday during happy hour. This is a cute and quiet spot. We ate inside because of the heat, but I can't wait to go back to sit on the patio they have. Started off with a glass of white sangria with peaches. Happy hour price of $4.00, this was so good. I was only able to drink half the glass since I was driving and it was very strong. I am looking forward to enjoying this again when I have a driver :). For appetizers we shared artichoke and spinach dip, it came with some toasted bread. This was the most delicious artichoke/spinach dip I have ever had. We also tried out some bruschetta. I had the one with prosciutto, mozzarella and pesto sauce. And also the one with green apples, brie and fig jam. I have no complaints about this place, service was great, food was good and happy hour prices were decent. I also loved the decor. I can't wait to go back and sit on the patio, enjoy some more sangria and taste the flatbread that looked A M A ZI NG . Our total bill for 3 glasses of sangria and 2 appetizers came out to $33.00, not bad at all.
Cute little place with awesome food and drinks!!!! Great location!!!! Amazing for romantic dinner!!!!!

I was looking for a unique setting to have a Holiday party for my staff of 17.  Heinrich was gracious and accommodated my request to have the function on the patio with heaters and surrounding the large fire pit.  It was great!  The wait staff, especially Kristen, did a great job making sure everyone had what they wished.  I'm looking forward to bringing my wife and this time I can enjoy the wine menu too!

I have been a customer at Timos for few years,food went from excellent to ok, to not good.tonite I got the worst,burned panini (half of if was charred)And old as dirt chips. When I told the waitress how stale the chips were she said "they keep them out"And offered a salad instead...well thank you ,but if you knew about old product being served,why did you bring it over?
I also mentioned my bread was burned..
Nothing on her part.screw you timo!So long

Very cute place. My hunny and i stumbled onto this place one night and it was great. I had the pizza - excellent. 

Service was awesome - always checkin up on us but wasn't annoying about it. Cant wait to go back

This place is cool!  I like how their patio faces away from the street noise.  And they have big firepits out there too.  Wine was good too.  I didn't try the food but we will try that next time.  Servers were friendly and prompt.  I wish they had the NFL Network because I was missing Thursday Night Football, but I get that's it's not a sports bar.

I must be a sucker for wine bars....they are just so good! I went to Timo after finding it on Yelp while hiking North mountain with my step mom Deb. We were hiking and, of course, thinking about food...lol. So we went to Timo, which is this cute little place that is largely hidden from the road by big trees. We sat on the patio for Sunday brunch. The service was great, very attentive and the atmosphere was wonderful....so relaxing. They didn't even treat us badly despite our being dirty and (probably) smelly. We shared the bacon and fig (?) pizza and the rocket salad. The pizza was HUGE and ridiculously good....the pizza was piled with bacon and sweet onions...so flavorful. The salad was also good...it had sort of weird dried raspberries and blueberries on it that were almost like croutons because they were crunchy but had the flavor of the fruit...yum. I would definitely come back here again...maybe next time I'll try the benedict (which also looked pretty fabulous).
First time here..lasagna and a bottle of wine for 22 bucks..great deal..great food.great service. We will be back..

Great value, outstanding food, tasty cocktails, what more could you ask for. Took the Mrs. out for a date and despite her general anger and cantankerous nature she was just as pleased as I was. Our waitress Alexis was a doll and captained the meal ship directly to tasty island!! Yar! But in all seriousness, highly recommend Timo!

Have been here many times but this is a first for "Timo Tuesday".  The special was a glass of wine and one of their new summer appetizers, the Hummus platter. It was a little plate of goodness. It had a roasted garlic, spicy hummus with tomatoes, red onion, olives and feta with pita bread. We finished the night off with the Caprese Salad, which never disappoints. Well done, Timo !
Our server, Jaclyn was super friendly, attentive and always had a smile. Great job tonight, Jaclyn !

Went  today for brunch at 10am.
I ordered Timo hash skillet it sound wonderful over easy eggs sausage potatoes well that's not what I got.
The eggs were hard and cold like they had prepared them earlier then reheated them 
There were 2 little potatoes no bigger than my thumb nail , 2 tiny pieces of burnt sausage and a puddle of grease served with cold toasted hard bread. I asked for butter and it was even harder than the bread.
I asked the waitress Alyssa for new over easy eggs she did bring back two of the same hard cold eggs congealed on the yolks. I don't think the cook knows how to make "over easy eggs"
Very disappointing $12.50 for nothing 
Also I was surprised they didn't have coffee ready had to wait about 10 minutes for them to brew coffee. Alyssa said she was the only waitress not a good experience

This place is a hole in the wall gem. Very easy going atmosphere. Food is consistenly good. Thier half of weds wine and menu of boards is somewhat reminiscent of Postino without the crazy crowd. Had the crab cake benedict which was perfectly cooked. The smashed rosemary  fingerlings and aspargus were good and plenty. And the absolute best is the pach cobbler in town. Save room for dessert. Would give 5 but the roasted chicken came out a bit undercooked. Staff was very attentive and gave us free meal replacement and dessert. More then made up. My only complaint is the music on the patio. Few good songs then would be off for 30 min, then on go 2 more good songs. Music was great, it is necessary. Fix it!

The food was amazing, the service was friendly, and the decor was pleasant without being stuffy.  In our party of four we ALL cleaned our plates (which is not normal for us). Two standouts were the fresh, warm bread with pesto (very good) and citrus butter (sublime) for an appetizer and the peach cobbler for desert.  We are definitely going back!

Our server Adrian should of taken the night off or dropped the attitude.  We have been there many times with great service, tonight not so much.  He had an attitude right  away because he was told to take our table as he was working inside.  It took him forever to get our order and when we asked what time happy hour was over and what time is currently was he has no idea only to come back ofter 6 and tell us we could not get happy hour prices.  I believe if you are going to work customer service you should be half way pleasant and not act like its a chore to service us especially adding your 20% to the bill which you would of NOT received

Since one of the earlier bartender, Amy, was so consistently good it's tough to have a poor girl that seems unhappy to be there.  This newer bartender is competent and will get your drink but no conversation or even 'how's it going tonight?'  And I'm talking about during an empty bar and just few people at the tables, 3 couples.  It's been this way for the last year. I've mentioned her lack of personality to others that were working and they nod and say 'sorry'.  The happy hour used to be packed- no room at the bar with regulars and new comers, but now very few people are ever there.  I'm a big fan of the laid-back personality but not in this type of bar setting.  I like this spot better than Ladera but over and over we are disappointed with the lack of personality with the entire place.  There is a very sweet table server  that chats with everyone and brings a bit of life to the experience. Please, please - new bartender!?!  I hate to see this spot close but they must be losing business.

Can I just say one of the best patios in Phoenix. I love going Monday nights for a pizza an a bottle
Of wine.  The lights and candles in the patio make it such a calm and romantic place. 
I like to go for happy hours too and I the jar of cava sangria, artichoke dip, and the tapas are delicious as well.
Jasmine our server made great tequila drink suggestions. The Up in smoke was fun & different & I loved the Burro mules! Happy hour drinks and food are classy and delectable.

I have known about this place for a long time, but this was my first visit.  My daughter enjoys wine and we were looking for a light meal, so we thought we would try the bar during her visit.  

Roasted veggie board was good even if the root veggies could have been roasted a bit longer.  The scallops were great.  Meatballs were entirely boring; service with bread would have helped.   I will be back to try other items.  

Service was terrible, both servers came by to tell us the other was serving us.  Neither did until we pointed out their confusion.  A six-top was finishing their meal in the house, the patio was nearly full, we were virtually ignored.  Until what turned out to be an owner checked on us.  Thanks Jason for the rescue.  Sunday staffing is rough on a holiday weekend.  It would have been nice if the server had offered to help with a wine or beverage selection for my daughter.  

Great neighborhood place.

Timo has to be one of the best hidden places in central Phoenix. They have a great menu and atmosphere. I've had Alexis as my server a few times and she is the best! I would highly reccomend asking for her as your server! They also had excellent specialty drinks! 
Keep up the good work!

Nice wine selection, bruschetta always good. More than anything, I love the ambience of this place. Used to come here when it was Bomberos. It's a great date night place, sitting by the fire pit, sampling wine and small plates.
all entrees were amazing! it was our first time and visiting from california. it was a nice family dinner with dessert and amazing servers and chef! will come again when i visit again

What a cool experience!  Amazing patio... The service staff brings it,  so pleasant and helpful.  The bartender, Amy, is a borderline superhero behind a rocks glass and shaker! Definitely conning back : )

Great wine, amazing food, awesome happy hour prices and wonderful staff! 

I recommend this place for anyone looking for a hidden away wine bar.

Every year the hubby and I go to the parking lot of Sunnyslope High and reenact our first kiss which took place in 1975.  We then go for a nice - hopefully romantic - meal at a local restaurant.  This year I made 9 pm reservations at Time which Yelp said was good and romantic.  We were seated out on the patio by the fire under a large tree.  It was a beautiful night with scent of orange blossoms.  Terrific!  We started out with a bottle of Max Mann Reisling which was crsip and cool.  We had tapas of mixed bar olives before our bruschetta.  We ordered the spicy copaiba, burrata and pesto, the sauteed mushrooms and brie and the apple brie as our 3 selections of bruschetta.  It was outstanding.  The flavors were terrific.  It was so good we ordered another tapas of Parmesan scallops as we finished our wine.  It was a wonderful and romantic meal.  The staff was very friendly.  We hope to go back soon!

Second visit to Timo this week. Had to make sure I was not dreaming about the first visit. First of all, last night's weather was perfect for outdoor dining. 86 degrees on the patio and that's where my two guests and I dined. 
We started with drinks and proceeded to enjoy some Tapas. Mussels ($11.00) wings (not your ordinary bar wings) ($6.00)and a luscious Brie soup, so creamy ($8.00).Superb! 

I had the Pancetta Flat Bread. This is the second time having this entre ($11.00), friends split the Prosciutto sandwich with kettle chips. "One of the best sandwiches I've ever had" remarked Michael. And the Pancetta Flat Bread...I'm hooked!

We thought it would be a good idea to split a couple of desserts, chocolate Crème Brûlée ($6.75) and Peach Cobbler ($7.00). Wow.

Liked Bomberos...love the Timo's.

I really want to like this place more but they need a little TLC with their service. Atmosphere is a mix between a vig (arcadia) and postinos. Really cool fire pit makes for a nice loungy spot. Service is slowwwww. It seemed they only had 2 servers for the whole place. They were both rushing around and once tables got up to leave, tables stayed dirty and were never bussed...I suggest they get a server assistant to help run food! Things would go a lot more smoothly as a whole. Our server was very nice but he seemed so stressed! If you can't run a restaurant the right way, then why stay open. Bump up your staff so your restaurant can run the right way.

Update:After careful consideration, Timo's has reached out to me to indicate that they have removed their Foie Gras item.  I feel that this is a responsible decision based on their part and this reflects their standards as a business.  Therefore, I am removing my past rating and replacing them with what I truly feel that they deserve.  I will revisit and am more than positive that I will have a stellar dining experience.  Thank you, Timo's.

This is really more of a 3.5 star place than 4 but I'm feeling generous today. I love the drive up Central to this place as the homes remind me of where I grew up so it pushed it to the 4.

I've been to Timo twice now, once for lunch inside during the week with a girlfriend and most recently, with my fiance for dinner on the patio. I do remember thinking the place was really cute inside and I really enjoyed the patio at dinner, though it was a bit chilly the night we went and were never offered a heater. I didn't encounter flies on the patio as another yelper mentioned but I did have a tree just over head that was shedding it's needle shaped leaves that were all over our table and chairs when we arrived. The hostess never offered to sweep them off and just placed the menu's over them so we had to clear them off ourselves. Luckily none ended up in our food, at least not that I noticed or tasted :) 

We both ordered the butternut squash soup and I thought it was delicious! I even ate what my fiance couldn't because I thought it was so good. I opted for the oven-roasted chicken salad, which was good once I added another dressing option to give it more flavor and my fiance got the spicy salami pizza. His pizza was definitely spicy though because his nose was running and he was sweating but he said he enjoyed it! 

Service was pretty slow all night but that was okay since we weren't in any hurry and we had a mix of waiters throughout the evening. All in all, this place is cute and has pretty good food and I like the firepit on the patio. It would a good place to grab a few drinks and relax for an our or two even if you didn't want to eat.
